data.title: Awards Day Recipients
data.meta_description: Each year we celebrate the service, scholarship, leadership and character of our student community with an Awards Day celebration.
data.text:
Shannon DePratter

Driven by a passion to help others, South Carolina Honors College senior Shannon DePratter participated in several service organizations while completing her degree in biomedical engineering — a degree she completed in only three years. During her time at the university, the Newberry, South Carolina, native served as president of the Theta Tau professional engineering fraternity and also focused on mentoring and leading younger students while working to make organizations more accessible and inclusive for all students.

Edgar Lemus Rivera

First-generation senior Edgar Lemus Rivera plans to continue his dedication to volunteerism and service by working his way through medical school to become a physician. The biochemistry and molecular biology major from Toms River, New Jersey, plans to continue his education at the USC School of Medicine Greenville. In addition to volunteering with the Good Samaritan Clinic in Columbia and serving as vice president of the Phi Delta Epsilon medical fraternity, he helped restart workshops for students navigating the process of applying to medical school.

Natalie Trimble

South Carolina Honors College senior and nursing student Natalie Trimble is recognized in the areas of service, leadership, academics and research. In addition to serving in various capacities in Student Government and Student Senate, she volunteered in the Columbia community and for nonprofits including the Free Medical Clinic and Cocky’s Canine PAALS. Her research, including projects studying the relationship between stress and chronic conditions in college students, and the effects of continuity of care for people with diabetes, were presented at Harvard University, Discover USC and the Council for the Advancement of Nursing Science.
